name: Lung cancer mortality rates (per 100,000) (2022)
title: Lung cancer mortality rates (per 100,000) (2022)
description:
Age-standardized mortality rates (per 100,000 people) due to lung, bronchus or trachea cancer. The data is from the WHO Mortality database: https://platform.who.int/mortality

This dataset should be next updated by the source by May 2023. We will update it on Our World in Data soon after the new version is published. At the link above you can directly access the source page and see the latest available data.

sources.name: WHO Mortality Database (2022)
sources.additionalInfo:
Age-standardized mortality rates (per 100,000 people) due to lung, bronchus or trachea cancer. The data is from the WHO Mortality database: https://platform.who.int/mortality

This dataset should be next updated by the source by May 2023. We will update it on Our World in Data soon after the new version is published. At the link above you can directly access the source page and see the latest available data.

fields.name: age-standardized_death_rate_per_100k_female
fields.owidDisplaySettings: {"name": "Female lung cancer deaths per 100,000", "unit": "deaths per 100,000", "includeInTable": true, "numDecimalPlaces": 2}

fields.name: age-standardized_death_rate_per_100k_male
fields.owidDisplaySettings: {"name": "Male lung cancer deaths per 100,000", "unit": "deaths per 100,000", "includeInTable": true, "numDecimalPlaces": 2}
